derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent.: from late Latin superhumanus (see super-, human)

entry.tran: 超出常人的;非凡的;超人的
entry.def: If you describe a quality that someone has as superhuman, you mean that it seems to be much greater than that of ordinary people.

example.ex: Officers were terrified of his superhuman strength...
example.tran: 军官们被他超凡的力量吓坏了。

example.ex: They saw their bills rising steadily, in spite of superhuman efforts to save water.
example.tran: 尽管他们已想方设法节约用水，水费仍旧在稳步上升。

means.word_mean: 1. above or beyond the human or demanding more than human power or endurance;

auth_sentence.content: But these were human errors on a superhuman journey.

auth_sentence.content: Perhaps only his left foot is his superhuman?

auth_sentence.content: Just saying a superhuman being created life etc.

means.word_mean: 超人的, 超出常人能力的;非凡的, 超常的

sentences.en: It will require a superhuman effort to get the job finished on time.
sentences.cn: 要按时完成这项工作需要作出非凡的努力。
